title: WH Smith's Money Mistake Investigation
summary: WH Smith, a store company in the UK, is being checked by a financial regulator because it made a big mistake with its money numbers in North America. The mistake might have made the company look like it earned more money than it really did, by as much as Â£50 million. Because of this, the company's boss left, and its share price dropped a lot. WH Smith also sold many of its High Street shops and now focuses on stores in places like airports and train stations. The company is working to fix its money problems and plans to improve its stores in the future. It says it was a tough end to the year and wants to rebuild trust with people who invest in it.

background_read: WH Smith is a company that sells things like books, snacks, and travel items. It started in the UK and has stores in many places. Companies often have to report how much money they make and spend to investors and regulators. When they make mistakes in these reports, it can cause problems like people losing trust or bosses leaving. This article talks about WH Smith's recent trouble with a money mistake and how it's trying to fix things.
Article_Structure: WHO: WH Smith, a retailer, and the Financial Conduct Authority, a UK regulator
WHAT: An investigation into accounting mistakes in North America that overstated revenues
WHERE: In the UK and North America
WHY: To check if rules were broken and rebuild confidence after the error
